intro: Cremanthodium calotum, commonly known as the golden globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late summer. It has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Cremanthodium calotum thrives in rocky, arid environments and is often found in desert regions.
